loon.ggplot 1.1.1

Reference

Main Function

A bridge between loon widgets and gg objects. It can take either a loon widget, a gg object (ggplot or ggmatrix) or a lggplot object, then create a corresponding gg (or loon) graphics.

loon.ggplot()

loon.ggplot

An interactive `loon` widget to a static `ggplot` object

loon2ggplot()

loon to ggplot

g_getLocations()

get locations for ggmatrix

g_getPlots()

get ggplots

A static `ggplot` object to an interactive `loon` widget

ggplot2loon()

ggplot to loon

get_activeGeomLayers()

active geom layers

Automatically create a `loon` widget by the "ggplot rule"

Function l_ggplot() returns a lggplot object, then “print” a loon plot automatically.

l_ggplot()

Automatically create a loon widget

interactivity()

Modify the interactivity component

itemLabel()

Modify the itemLabel component

linking()

Modify the linking component

selecting()

Modify the selecting component

print(<lggplot>)

Explicitly draw plot

Accessories

Some useful functions for the transformation

layout_coords()

layout matrix

get_scaledData()

scale data

gg_pipe()

Pipe ggplot object

scaleBox()

Box scaling in 3D rotation

scale_multi()

Position scales for continuous data (x, y & z)

loonLayer()

Transform geom layers to loon layers

is.CoordPolar()

Is polar coordinate system?

Cartesianxy2Polarxy()

Transform the x, y positions from a Cartesian coordinate to a polar coordinate
